definition: performed with little or no delay, (computer science) a symbol that appears on the computer screen to indicate that the computer is ready to receive a command, serve as the inciting cause of
details:
adjective
- performed with little or no delay
= synonyms: straightaway
- according to schedule or without delay
- ready and willing or quick to act
= example: ready and willing or quick to act
noun
- (computer science) a symbol that appears on the computer screen to indicate that the computer is ready to receive a command
= synonyms: command prompt
- a cue given to a performer, usually consisting of the beginning of the next line to be spoken
= example: a cue given to a performer, usually consisting of the beginning of the next line to be spoken
= synonyms: prompting
verb
- serve as the inciting cause of
= example: serve as the inciting cause of
= synonyms: inspire, instigate
- assist (somebody acting or reciting) by suggesting the next words of something forgotten or imperfectly learned
= synonyms: cue, remind
- give an incentive for action
= synonyms: move
